text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies.

It is fall, and fall is my favorite season
because, the Nummies are usually

Caramel Dipped Apples! So, today we are gonna
be making Hello Kitty, meow!
Caramel Dipped Apples.

The things you will need, will be: 6 apples,
I have 3 here, a lot of people

use Granny Smith, or you can use your favorite
apple, I’m using Fiji’s because

I love them! You need toothpicks, caramel
melts, you’ll need 2 bags, lollipop

sticks, white chocolate melts, big marshmallows.
And to decorate, we’ve got

black and yellow jelly beans, I’ve just
separated a bunch of them, a red airhead,

so you’ll need the cherry flavor, a little
heart cookie cutter, and black icing.
Let’s get started!

Before we head over to the stove, we’re
just gonna stick these popsicle sticks

into the apple. Sometimes they go right in
and sometimes you’ll have to take like, a

little corkscrew or drill a hole, whatever
you want to do.

So I’m just gonna take a lollipop stick,
stick it right in the center.
Put my weight on it!
Oh yeah, there we go, perfect!

After you are done poking all of your apples,
we are going to take the apples
and our caramels over to the stove.

I’ve also put them on top of a baking sheet with
a piece of wax paper, so that after you

dip the apples in the caramel you can stick
them right on the wax paper and they

won’t stick to the surface. OK, let’s
go!

We’re here in the kitchen, caramel dipped
apples are so easy to make, my Mom

used to make these with me all the time. First
thing you’re gonna do is take a

medium sized saucepan, put the heat on low,
and unwrap all of your little

caramel chunks, like so. And then we’re
gonna put these in the pan with

1 tablespoon of water and stir and heat them
slowly.

Now that our caramel is all melted, we are
going to dip our apples, oooooh!

Just pick him up by the stick, then you’ll
dip it in the saucepan, then spin

it all around to get all the edges, then you’re
gonna lift your apple up,

let the excess drip off, and then stick him
back onto your baking sheet.

Once you got your caramel apples all dipped,
we’re gonna let them sit for

about 30 minutes, just to set, and then we’re
gonna put marshmallows and chocolate
and decorate ‘em. Num-num-num-num!

So what you’re gonna do take your big marshmallow,
and we’re just gonna take a

pair of baking scissors and cut it in half
diagonally.

They’re so cute! And they’ll sit on the
top of the apple and look like little ears!

And to secure them, what you can do, you don’t
have to do this, but I like to

take toothpicks, but you just have to remember
that you put toothpicks in

your apple! Stick them on the side, push them
in and then put
the marshmallows on top.

Just heated up all the white chocolate melts,
in this bowl in the microwave, but

you can do it over the stove, whatever is
easier for you. And now we’re

gonna take our caramel apple. They’re really
sticky! Errrrrrah!

There we go! And we’re just gonna submerge!
What I like to do is go straight down,
and then tilt to 1 side, flip it around, tilt to the other side.

Now I’m just gonna put it over onto this
tray.

I just got a piece of cardboard, like a cake
sheet, and then put a piece of

wax paper on top again. Once you’ve dipped
your apples, let them sit out again for

about 30 minutes, just to let them set, and
then we will start decorating!

To decorate our Hello Kitty Caramel Apples,
we are going to take black and yellow

jelly beans, and stick on 2 black for the
eyes, and 1 yellow for the nose.
Take a little black frosting.

Now that we’ve got the little faces decorated
with jelly beans, and little

frosting for the whiskers, we are going to
take our airhead, and unwrap it.
Errp! Here we go!

And we’re gonna use the little heart cookie
cutter, and we’re gonna cut out

2 hearts, make a little circle, put our 2
little hearts together, put the circle

right in the middle so it makes this cute
little bow. Perfect!

Then we’re gonna make 3 of those, stick
‘em right on kitty!
Ta-da!

Our Hello Kitty Caramel Chocolate Dipped Apples are
all done! They are so cute! They

turned out really, really well! I just think
that they’re perfect for Fall!
I love caramel dipped apples in the fall!

If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!

October is right around the corner, so if
you have any ideas for anything spooky,

heh-heh-heh-heh-heh! Now is a good time to
start letting me know, and I’ll do my
best to make it happen.
OK, thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!
